result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

4:43 PM Defendant Dell Lavon Cornelius Brown appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney William Andrew Mayer appeared by phone for Dell Lavon Cornelius Brown.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Atty Meyer advises this case is not resolved. Offer has been rejected. court grants State's motions in Limine 1-19, Def to wear RACK belt during JT. Def's Motions in Limine reviewed Court grants 1-7, and Count 8 denied. One panel will be called in, Court will hold 2 alternates, 5 strikes each, Seating 24 Jurors during Voir Dire. No Miranda Goodchild hearing needed.

1:22 PM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dell Lavon Cornelius Brown in court, in custody. Attorney William Andrew Mayer appeared by phone for Dell Lavon Cornelius Brown. 
Investigator Michael Thielke- sworn and testified. D, X.
Witness identifies Deft. in court.
Probable Cause Found, Defendant bound over.
Information filed/reading waived, Not guilty plea entered all Counts. 
Deft. filed a pro-se bond motion prior to counsel. Attorney Mayer prepared to addressed. Deft. unable to post high cash bond, requesting a reduced bond(min. $500, requesting a signature bond). State objecting to any bond modification. Court denies bond motion.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Scheduling conference on October 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Mayer is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $100 per month until total sum is paid.
The first payment shall be made on 10/01/22.  
Failure to make payment on the schedule as established above shall result in the remaining balance becoming immediately due. Sheboygan County through its Corporation Counsel, may initiate a lawsuit or other collection action against you to collect the amount due, together with costs.
The attorney shall be compensated at $100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.
To receive payment, bill must be submitted within 90 days of withdrawal or case disposition

Copy provided to DE in SCDC
